reviews.review_msg: Nicole is a really sweet lady. Super knowledgeable, but her lectures are a bit boring.
Class was very interesting but she's a terrible lecturer.

Missed a lot of lectures in Fall 2015 due to sickness and Jackson not finding a lecture room for us. This plus two guest speakers meant that we missed half the classes of the semester.  Also speaks really quietly and takes her time going through lectures. Tutorials were great though, lots of discussion.

I am a third year IS major and he is the hardest marker I have ever come across in the department. He overemphasizes grammar and spelling. My feedback on my paper was that my concepts and structure were excellent but my sentences were a bit awkward... therefore I got a C- on the paper. The midterm was also pretty hard. The average mark was a D.

Checkel is an interesting character. His lectures are eccentric, though entertaining at 8am. Readings are various papers, and pretty long but manageable. You'll need them to survive the tutorial discussions, as well as the papers and tests. I hear he and his TA's are tough markers. I got A's, but I heard I was one of 3 or 4 out of a couple hundred.

Good at lecturing, is clear & what we learned was very interesting. Is a tough marker & has high expectation however I honestly think that if you put in the effort and get it proofread you should do well. Don't procrastinate. Lots of reading, a bit too much honestly but he does go over it in lecture. Its not easy but I did learn alot. Not easy A, B

Interesting content but Insanely tough marker! Distribution of grades worse than a curved course. Very high writing expectations for grammar, style and content. Plan to read 2+ chapters a week, readings are essential. He expects heavy engagement w the text. MT: all essay Qs with no choices. Final: take home, 3 essay Qs. Final paper: 8-10 pages.

The hardest grader I've ever come across at SFU. Marks the term papers and exams as an English professor. Everything is about style and grammar. Avoid Checkel at all costs! The average grade in my class was about a C.

One of the worst profs I have ever had.  All of the readings were academic essays that were so boring I could barely make it through them.  His voice is very difficult to listen to and he often gets so quiet it is almost as if he is talking to himself. I went to every class and tried my absolute hardest on all assignments and still did terribly.

Jason is a really caring prof, very approachable and overall a nice guy. But do not take this class unless you are interested in this stuff. It has a lot to do with war and conflicts. A lot of hard readings. Not hard to get a good grade because he makes sure the average is always a B+ but for me it was extremely boring and made no sense.

This course is interesting and engaging because the theories and required readings are applicable to situations in the real world, overall a solid course as an introduction to International Security. Jason is an exceptional prof, his interest in the subject shows, and he encourages students to ask questions/ask for clarification if needed.
Friendly prof and solid class overall, a good intro to international security and conflict
